sen.j: 前方後円墳 （ぜんぽうこうえんふん）は、日本における古墳の一形式。
sen.e: A keyhole-shaped tumulus (called zenpo koen-fun in Japanese) is a form of kofun (tumuli) in Japan.

sen.j: 平面が円形と方形の墳丘を組み合わせた形状は、日本独特の特徴である。
sen.e: The shape that combines two burial mounds, whose plane surfaces are round and square, is unique to Japan.

sen.e: As regards the shape, it is considered today that it was formed when the passage portion of the round tomb covered with a heap of earth developed and merged into the burial mound.

sen.j: 「前方」とは「前半分が方形（四角形）である」という意味である。
sen.e: Zenpo' (expressed as 前方 in kanji, or Chinese characters) means that 'the front half is a square,' taking the first letters of 前半分 (the first half) and 方形 (a square).

sen.j: 日本が起源である前方後円墳についてこれまで幾つかの議論がおこなわれている。
sen.e: There have been some discussions concerning keyhole-shaped tumuli originating in Japan.

sen.j: 最もよく知れられているものは、弥生時代の墳墓から独自に発展したものであるという学説である。
sen.e: The most famous theory is that they developed uniquely from the Yayoi-period tombs protruding from the earth.
The most famous theory is that they developed uniquely from the above-ground tombs of the Yayoi-period.

sen.e: The most famous theory is that they developed uniquely from the above-ground tombs of the Yayoi-period.

sen.j: この説においては従来より存在した円形墳丘墓の周濠を掘り残した陸橋部分（通路部分）が造られた。
sen.e: According to this theory, a land bridge (or a passage) was created by digging a moat around the pre-existing round tomb that was covered with a heap of earth, except for a part that was made into the bridge.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: According to this theory, a land bridge (or overpass) was created by leaving part of earth unexcavated when building a moat around the existing round barrow.

sen.j: これが発達し、墓（死の世界）と人間界を繋ぐ陸橋として墳丘と一体化したと考えられる。
sen.e: This section developed and merged into the burial mound serving as a land bridge connecting the world of humans with a tomb (the world of death).

sen.e: In contrast, Sueji UMEHARA has proposed a theory arguing that it is the influence of mainland China.

sen.j: 梅原は秦始皇帝陵及び兵馬俑坑などの前方に設けられていた祭壇などに由来するとしている。
sen.e: He claims that it originates in the altar and other things that lied anterior to the mausoleum of the first Quin Emperor, the pit filled with lifelike images of soldiers and horses, and so on.

sen.j: 前方後円墳の形状は、古くはヒョウタン形などとも形容されていた。
sen.e: In ancient times, keyhole-shaped tumuli were described as being gourd-shaped.

sen.j: 「前方後円」の語は、江戸時代の国学者蒲生君平が19世紀初めに著した『山陵志』で初めで使われた。
sen.e: The term 'front-square rear-round' (pronounced zenpo koen in Japanese) was first used in "Sanryoshi" written by a Japanese classical scholar of the Edo Period, Kunpei GAMO, in the early nineteenth century.

sen.j: 蒲生は、各地に残る「車塚」という名から、前方後円墳は宮車を模倣したものだと考えた。
sen.e: GAMO reasoned from the name 'kurumazuka,' which is found in various places, that keyhole-shaped tumuli were modeled after a kyusha.

sen.j: 明治末期になり、ゴーランドは円墳と方墳が結合したと推測した。
sen.e: At the end of the Meiji Period, William GOWLAND conjectured that a round barrow and a square barrow were combined to form a keyhole-shaped tumulus.

sen.e: Likewise, Kanji KIYONO hypothesized that the main barrow and a baicho (a small barrow next to a large-scale tumulus) were joined together to give the keyhole-shape.

sen.e: The style of constructing keyhole-shaped tumuli began to change in the sixth century.
The style of constructing keyhole-shaped tumuli began to change in the sixth century.

sen.j: 関東地方以西ではほとんどの前方後円墳の規模が縮小した。
sen.e: Most of those in the east of the Kanto region were made in smaller scale.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Most of those built in the west of the Kanto region were smaller in size.
Most of those built in the west of the Kanto region were smaller in size.

sen.j: そして、墳丘長100メートル以上の規模の比較的大きなものは九州の岩戸山古墳、尾張の断夫山古墳など一部を除くと、奈良盆地内や古市古墳群など、畿内に集中するようになる。
sen.e: Relatively large-scale, keyhole-shaped tumuli with a burial mound longer than 100 meters were concentrated in the Nara Basin and the Kinai region (five central provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto, namely Yamato, Kawachi, Settsu, Izumi, and Yamashiro that are now the municipalities of Kyoto and Osaka and the prefectures of Nara and Hyogo) including Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group, with some exceptions such as Iwatoyama-kofun Tumulus in Kyushu and Danpusan-kofun Tumulus in Owari.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Larger keyhole-shaped tumuli with a burial mound longer than 100 meters were concentrated in the Nara Basin and the Kinai region (five central provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto, namely Yamato, Kawachi, Settsu, Izumi, and Yamashiro that are now the municipalities of Kyoto and Osaka and the prefectures of Nara and Hyogo) including Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group, with some exceptions such as Iwatoyama-kofun Tumulus in Kyushu and Danpusan-kofun Tumulus in Owari.
sen.cmt: Relatively large-scale' を 'Larger' に変更。
sen.e: Larger keyhole-shaped tumuli with a burial mound longer than 100 meters were concentrated in the Nara Basin and the Kinai region (five central provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto, namely Yamato, Kawachi, Settsu, Izumi, and Yamashiro that are now the municipalities of Kyoto and Osaka and the prefectures of Nara and Hyogo) including Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group, with some exceptions such as Iwatoyama-kofun Tumulus in Kyushu and Danpusan-kofun Tumulus in Owari.

sen.j: また岩戸山古墳と断夫山古墳、そして畿内でも大王墓の可能性が高い古墳とその他の古墳との規模の格差が拡大している。
sen.e: The size difference also grew larger, not only between Iwatoyama-kofun Tumulus and Danpusan-kofun Tumulus, but also between the tumuli that most likely belong to Okimi (His Majesty) and the rest inside the Kinai region.

The size difference also grew larger, not only between Iwatoyama-kofun Tumulus and Danpusan-kofun Tumulus, but also between the tumuli that most likely belong to Okimi (His Majesty) and the rest inside the Kinai region.

The size difference also grew larger, not only between Iwatoyama-kofun Tumulus and Danpusan-kofun Tumulus, but also between the tumuli that most likely belong to Okimi (His Majesty) and the rest inside the Kinai region.

sen.j: これは当時の社会体制の変化を表しているものと考えられる。
sen.e: This is thought to reflect a change in the social system of the time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: This is thought to reflect a change in the social system of the time.
This is thought to reflect a change in the social system of the time.

sen.j: 特に河内大塚山古墳、見瀬丸山古墳、今城塚古墳といった大王墓と見られる古墳の規模は他を圧している。
sen.e: Especially, the tombs that are speculated to be of Okimi, including Kawachi Otsukayama-kofun Tumulus, Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, and Imashirozuka-kofun Tumulus, overpower the rest in terms of scale.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The tombs that are considered to be of Okimi, including Kawachi Otsukayama-kofun Tumulus, Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, and Imashirozuka-kofun Tumulus, in particular, dominate the rest in size.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくしてあります。
sen.e: The tombs that are considered to be of Okimi, including Kawachi Otsukayama-kofun Tumulus, Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, and Imashirozuka-kofun Tumulus, in particular, dominate the rest in size.

sen.j: これまでの有力首長の共同統治から大王への権力の集中が始まったものと見られている。
sen.e: It is believed that the power that was shared among powerful chiefs began to concentrate in the hands of Okimi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is believed that the power that had previously been shared among dominant chiefs began to concentrate in the hands of Okimi.
sen.cmt: 時制を修正して読みやすくしてあります。
sen.e: It is believed that the power that had previously been shared among dominant chiefs began to concentrate in the hands of Okimi.

sen.j: 見瀬丸山古墳など6世紀の大王墓と推定される墳墓は、3世紀から大王墓が造られ続けてきた古市古墳群、百舌鳥古墳群、馬見古墳群、佐紀盾列古墳群、大和・柳本古墳群といった古墳群から離れた場所に造られている。
sen.e: The sixth-century tombs that are presumed to belong to Okimi, like Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, are built somewhere away from the kofun-tumuli groups that were formed by the continuous construction of Okimi tombs beginning in the third century, such as Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group, Mozu-kofun Tumuli Group, Umami-kofun Tumuli Group, Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Group, and Oyamato and Yanagimoto-kofun Tumuli Group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The sixth-century tombs that are presumed to belong to Okimi, like Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, are built somewhere away from the kofun-tumuli groups that were formed by the continuous construction of Okimi tombs beginning in the third century, such as Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group, Mozu-kofun Tumuli Group, Umami-kofun Tumuli Group, Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Group, and Oyamato and Yanagimoto-kofun Tumuli Group.

The sixth-century tombs that are presumed to belong to Okimi, like Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, are built somewhere away from the kofun-tumuli groups that were formed by the continuous construction of Okimi tombs beginning in the third century, such as Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group, Mozu-kofun Tumuli Group, Umami-kofun Tumuli Group, Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Group, and Oyamato and Yanagimoto-kofun Tumuli Group.

sen.j: この点からも6世紀の大王 (ヤマト王権)の権力構造に変化が生じたことがわかる。
sen.e: This also suggests that the power structure involving Okimi (of Yamato Sovereignty) changed in the sixth century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: This also suggests that the power structure involving Okimi (of Yamato Sovereignty) changed in the sixth century.
This also suggests that the power structure involving Okimi (of Yamato Sovereignty) changed in the sixth century.

sen.j: また前方後円墳の形式にも変化が生じる。
sen.e: Additionally, the format of keyhole-shaped tumuli went through some changes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Additionally, the style of keyhole-shaped tumuli went through some changes.
Additionally, the style of keyhole-shaped tumuli went through some changes.

sen.j: 陪塚が見られなくなる。
sen.e: Baicho disappeared.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Baicho disappeared.
Baicho disappeared.

sen.j: 葺石の使用も少なくなる。
sen.e: The use of fuki-ishi (stones covering the surface of a burial mound) diminished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The use of fuki-ishi (stones covering the surface of a burial mound) diminished.
The use of fuki-ishi (stones covering the surface of a burial mound) diminished.

sen.j: そして、墳丘の段築も3段が基本であったものが2段に減少する。
sen.e: And the standard number of terraces was reduced from three to two.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The standard number of terraces was reduced from three to two.
The standard number of terraces was reduced from three to two.

sen.j: そして関東地方を除くと埴輪も使用されないようになっていく。
sen.e: Furthermore, the use of haniwa (burial mound figurines) came to a halt, except in the Kanto region.
Furthermore, the use of haniwa (burial mound figurines) came to a halt, except in the Kanto region.
Furthermore, the use of haniwa (burial mound figurines) came to a halt, except in the Kanto region.

sen.j: つまり6世紀の前方後円墳は大きさばかりではなく視覚的な見栄えも低下している。
sen.e: In short, not only the scale but also the visual appearance of keyhole-shaped tumuli deteriorated in the sixth century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In short, not only the scale but also the visual appearance of keyhole-shaped tumuli deteriorated in the sixth century.
In short, not only the scale but also the visual appearance of keyhole-shaped tumuli deteriorated in the sixth century.

sen.j: 当時の社会における前方後円墳そのものの位置づけにも変化が起きてきたと考えられる。
sen.e: It would appear that the social positioning of keyhole-shaped tumuli themselves was also beginning to vary.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It would appear that the social significance of keyhole-shaped tumuli of the time was also beginning to change.
sen.cmt: social positioning' を'social significance' に変更。
sen.e: It would appear that the social significance of keyhole-shaped tumuli of the time was also beginning to change.

sen.j: 一方、関東地方では他の地方とは異なり、6世紀、埼玉古墳群など墳丘長100メートルクラスを含む前方後円墳が盛んに造られる。
sen.e: In contrast, in the Kanto region unlike other regions, keyhole-shaped tumuli including those whose burial mounds are as long as 100 meters like Saitama-kofun Tumuli Group were actively constructed in the sixth century.

In contrast, unlike elsewhere, in the Kanto region, many keyhole-shaped tumuli including those with burial mounds being as long as 100 meters such as Saitama-kofun Tumuli Group were constructed in the sixth century.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくしてあります。
sen.e: In contrast, unlike elsewhere, in the Kanto region, many keyhole-shaped tumuli including those with burial mounds being as long as 100 meters such as Saitama-kofun Tumuli Group were constructed in the sixth century.

sen.j: 埼玉古墳群では長方形をした二重周濠の築造、下野の前方後円墳では基壇と呼ばれる広い平坦面を持った前方後円墳など、地域色が見られる前方後円墳が造られている。
sen.e: Keyhole-shaped tumuli were build with regional characteristics, such as Saitama-kofun Tumuli Group with a rectangular, two-layered surrounding moat and a keyhole-shaped tumulus in Shimotsuke with a wide plane surface called kidan (a platform on which a tomb was placed).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Keyhole-shaped tumuli were build with regional characteristics, such as Saitama-kofun Tumuli Group with a rectangular double moat and a keyhole-shaped tumulus in Shimotsuke with a wide plane surface called kidan (a platform on which a tomb was placed).

Keyhole-shaped tumuli were build with regional characteristics, such as Saitama-kofun Tumuli Group with a rectangular double moat and a keyhole-shaped tumulus in Shimotsuke with a wide plane surface called kidan (a platform on which a tomb was placed).

sen.j: そして、6世紀の段階ではまだ全国一律の造墓規制を行う段階には至っていない。
sen.e: At the time of the sixth century, uniform regulations with respect to the construction of tombs were not yet applied throughout the country.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: During the sixth century, across-the-board regulations concerning the construction of tombs were yet to be implemented nationwide.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくしてあります。
sen.e: During the sixth century, across-the-board regulations concerning the construction of tombs were yet to be implemented nationwide.

sen.j: 前方後円墳の出現期から、大王陵と見られる大型の古墳を始めとする多くの前方後円墳が集中的に造られてきた畿内。
sen.e: Many keyhole-shaped tumuli, including large-scale tumuli that are considered to be the mausoleums of Okimi, were intensively constructed in Kinai from when they first appeared.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: From the time when they first appeared, construction of keyhole-shaped tumuli, including large-scale tumuli that are considered to be the mausoleums of Okimi, was concentrated in Kinai
sen.cmt: were intensively constructed' は可笑しいので変更。
sen.e: From the time when they first appeared, construction of keyhole-shaped tumuli, including large-scale tumuli that are considered to be the mausoleums of Okimi, was concentrated in Kinai

sen.j: その畿内の古墳群では、6世紀半ばに古市古墳群で前方後円墳の築造が終了した後、前方後円墳は造られないようになった。
sen.e: However, the keyhole-shaped tumulus built in the Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group in the mid-sixth century was the last constructed in any of the kofun-tumuli groups found in Kinai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, the keyhole-shaped tumulus built in the Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group in the mid-sixth century was the last constructed in any of the kofun-tumuli groups found in Kinai.
However, the keyhole-shaped tumulus built in the Furuichi-kofun Tumuli Group in the mid-sixth century was the last constructed in any of the kofun-tumuli groups found in Kinai.

sen.j: そして、6世紀後半になると、全国各地で前方後円墳が造られないようになっていく。
sen.e: Their construction also stopped throughout the country in the latter part of the sixth century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In the latter part of the sixth century, construction of these tombs ceased throughout the country.
sen.cmt: 英語圏の読者にとって読みやすくしてあります。
sen.e: In the latter part of the sixth century, construction of these tombs ceased throughout the country.

sen.j: 大王陵としても6世紀後半に造営されたとみられる見瀬丸山古墳か梅山古墳、または太子西山古墳を最後に前方後円墳から方墳へと変わった。
sen.e: The shape of the mausoleums of Okimi also changed from a keyhole to a square after the construction of either Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, Umeyama-kofun Tumulus, or Taishi Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus, all of which are believed to have been built in the second half of the sixth century.

The shape of the mausoleums of Okimi also changed from a keyhole to a square after the construction of Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, Umeyama-kofun Tumulus and Taishi Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus, all of which are believed to have been built in the second half of the sixth century.
sen.cmt: the construction of either Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, Umeyama-kofun Tumulus, or Taishi Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus’ を変更。
sen.e: The shape of the mausoleums of Okimi also changed from a keyhole to a square after the construction of Mise Maruyama-kofun Tumulus, Umeyama-kofun Tumulus and Taishi Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus, all of which are believed to have been built in the second half of the sixth century.

sen.j: 関東地方や周防など、一部の地域で7世紀初め～前半まで前方後円墳の築造が続いたケースもある。
sen.e: Keyhole-shaped tumuli continued to have been built in some regions like Kanto, Suo, and so on between the beginning and the first half of the seventh century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Keyhole-shaped tumuli continued to have been built in some regions such as Kanto and Suo between the beginning and the first half of the seventh century.
sen.cmt: like Kanto, Suo, and so on ’を変更。
sen.e: Keyhole-shaped tumuli continued to have been built in some regions such as Kanto and Suo between the beginning and the first half of the seventh century.

sen.j: しかし、おおむね6世紀末までに前方後円墳の築造は終了する。
sen.e: However, their construction was largely terminated by the end of the sixth century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, their construction came to an end for the most part by the late sixth century.
However, their construction came to an end for the most part by the late sixth century.

sen.j: その後、首長墓は主に円墳ないし方墳に移行する。
sen.e: Afterward, the tombs of the chiefs changed over, mainly to round and square barrows.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Afterward, the tombs of the chiefs changed mainly to round and square barrows in shape.
Afterward, the tombs of the chiefs changed mainly to round and square barrows in shape.

sen.j: 大王墓など一部の首長墓は八角墳などの多角形墳に移行する。
sen.e: Yet, some of them like those of Okimi switched over to polygon- including octagon-shaped tumuli.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Some tombs of the chiefs such as those of Okimi changed to polygon-shape including octagon-shape.
Some tombs of the chiefs such as those of Okimi changed to polygon-shape including octagon-shape.

sen.j: 前方後円墳は、憤丘（前方部・後方部・造出）、埋葬施設（棺室・槨室・石室）、副葬品、外表施設（封土固めの葺石、祭祀用の土器・埴輪など）などの諸要素から成っている。
sen.e: Keyhole-shaped tumuli consist of various elements including a burial mound (the front square, the rounded rear, and tsukuridashi, or a space for religious ceremonies), burial facilities (a coffin room, an outer coffin room, and a stone chamber), burial goods, and external facilities (fuki-ishi for hardening the mound covering a tomb and the earthenware, haniwa, and so on used in rituals).

Keyhole-shaped tumuli consist of various elements including a burial mound (the front square, the rounded rear, and tsukuridashi, or a space for religious ceremonies), burial facilities (a coffin room, a compartment protecting coffin room, and a stone chamber), gravel goods, and external facilities (fuki-ishi for hardening the mound covering a tomb and the earthenware, haniwa, and the other related items used in rituals).
sen.cmt: 槨室は「朝鮮三国時代の墳墓における棺・槨・室構造の特質とその変遷」https://kaken.nii.ac.jp/en/p/18520583/2008/4/ja での訳を使いました。副葬品は grave goodsが定訳のようです。その他、'and so on' → 'and the other related items'
sen.e: Keyhole-shaped tumuli consist of various elements including a burial mound (the front square, the rounded rear, and tsukuridashi, or a space for religious ceremonies), burial facilities (a coffin room, a compartment protecting coffin room, and a stone chamber), gravel goods, and external facilities (fuki-ishi for hardening the mound covering a tomb and the earthenware, haniwa, and the other related items used in rituals).

sen.j: 後円部は、前方後円墳で最も大切な場所である。
sen.e: The rounded rear is the most important part of the keyhole-shaped tumuli.
The rounded rear is the most important part of the keyhole-shaped tumuli.
The rounded rear is the most important part of the keyhole-shaped tumuli.

sen.j: それは、そこに亡き首長を埋葬し、盛大に埋葬祭祀が行われてきたからである。
sen.e: This is because it was there where the deceased chief was buried and grand burial rituals were held.
This is because it was there where the deceased chief was buried and grand burial rituals were held.
This is because it was there where the deceased chief was buried and grand burial rituals were held.

sen.j: その頂上は狭いが平坦に造られている。
sen.e: The top is narrow, but it is made even.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Its top is narrow and flat.
Its top is narrow and flat.

sen.j: その下の土中に埋葬を行うのに都合のよい形に造られている。
sen.e: Its shape is suited for burying the deceased in the ground underneath.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Its shape is suited for burying the deceased in the ground underneath.
Its shape is suited for burying the deceased in the ground underneath.

sen.j: 裾部から頂までは高く造られている。
sen.e: The distance from the bottom to the top is made large.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The distance from the bottom to the top is made large.
The distance from the bottom to the top is made large.

sen.j: その斜面の勾配は、平均的には25～26度ある。
sen.e: The angle of its slope is, on average, twenty-five to twenty-six degrees.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: On the average, the grade of its inclined plane is twenty-five to twenty-six degrees.
On the average, the grade of its inclined plane is twenty-five to twenty-six degrees.

sen.j: しかし、それ以上の急勾配もある。
sen.e: However, it can be sharper.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, it can be steeper.
However, it can be steeper.

sen.j: 築造当時には斜面に葺き石が敷かれて、登ることができないように造られている。
sen.e: Fuki-ishi were laid on the slope at the time of the construction to prevent climbing.
Fuki-ishi were laid on the slope at the time of the construction to keep people from climbing.
sen.cmt: 意味を明瞭にするために補足。
sen.e: Fuki-ishi were laid on the slope at the time of the construction to keep people from climbing.

sen.j: 前方部から後円部に登るために一つの工夫が為されている。
sen.e: There is a device that makes it possible to climb from the front square to the rounded rear.
There is a feature designed to permit people to climb on the rounded rear via the front square.
sen.cmt: 意味を明瞭にするために変更。
sen.e: There is a feature designed to permit people to climb on the rounded rear via the front square.

sen.j: それを隆起斜道（りゅうきしゃどう）という。
sen.e: It is called ryuki shado (a rising, slanting road).
It is called ryuki shado (a rising, slanting road).
It is called ryuki shado (a rising, slanting road).

sen.j: この隆起斜道の設置によって後円部と前方部が繋がることになる。
sen.e: The installation of ryuki sado allows the front square to connect to the rounded rear.
With installation of ryuki sado, the front square and the rounded rear are connected.
sen.cmt: 意味を明瞭にするために変更。
sen.e: With installation of ryuki sado, the front square and the rounded rear are connected.

sen.j: しかし、この斜道だけで、頂上や頂下の墓壙に達することが難しい場合が多い。
sen.e: However, it is often impossible to reach the summit and a burial pit underneath.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, it is often difficult to reach the top and a burial pit underneath by using ryuki sado alone.
sen.cmt: 訳抜け。意味を明瞭にするために補足。
sen.e: However, it is often difficult to reach the top and a burial pit underneath by using ryuki sado alone.

sen.j: そのため、斜道の途中から墓壙に達するための掘割墓道（ほりわりぼどう）を設置した。
sen.e: Thus, horiwari bodo (a trench path to the tomb) leading up to the pit is set up in the middle of the slanting road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Thus, horiwari bodo (a trench path to the tomb) leading up to the pit was built in the middle of the sloping road.
Thus, horiwari bodo (a trench path to the tomb) leading up to the pit was built in the middle of the sloping road.

sen.j: また、括れ部や前方部の斜面も急勾配に造られている。
sen.e: The slopes of the constricted portion and the square front are also made steep.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The slopes of the constricted portion and the square front are also made steep.
The slopes of the constricted portion and the square front are also made steep.

sen.j: そして、簡単に登ることができなくなっている。
sen.e: And they cannot be easily climbed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It makes climbing difficult.
sen.cmt: 意味を明瞭にするために変更。
sen.e: It makes climbing difficult.

sen.j: 葬列が登れるのは前方部の前面の左右の隅角のどちらか。
sen.e: A funeral procession can climb either the right or the left cornered intersection, which is located in the front of the square front.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: A funeral procession can climb on either the right or left corner at the front of the square front.
sen.cmt: 意味を明瞭にするために変更。
sen.e: A funeral procession can climb on either the right or left corner at the front of the square front.

sen.j: そして、そこを緩い斜面にして登りやすくしている。
sen.e: They are designed to be a gentle slope to facilitate climbing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: These areas were designed to form a gentle slope to facilitate climbing.

sen.j: 最古の前方後円墳は3世紀代の箸墓古墳のように前方部の前面幅が撥（バチ）形になっている。

sen.j: この造出に埋葬が行われている例が見られる。
sen.e: In some cases, a burial was held in tsukuridashi.
In some cases, burial services were held in tsukuridashi.

sen.e: In some cases, burial services were held in tsukuridashi.

sen.j: 埴輪を立て並べたり、形象埴輪を置いたりしている。
sen.e: Not only are haniwa lined up, but also figural haniwa are placed there.
Not only are haniwa lined up, but also figural haniwa are placed there.
Not only are haniwa lined up, but also figural haniwa are placed there.

sen.j: 祭祀・追葬が後円部や前方部の墳頂で行われるのではなく、括れ部裾付近に作られた造出で行われたことは、葬送儀礼の考え方が変わって来たのではないか。
sen.e: The fact that rituals and tsuiso (the burial of another individual in the same tumulus in which somebody else is already buried) were held in tsukuridashi built near the foot of the constricted portion of the tumulus, as opposed to the summit, suggests that there may have been a change in the way of thinking about funeral rites.

The fact that rituals and tsuiso (the burial of an individual in the same tumulus which has already been occupied by the remains of another person) were held in tsukuridashi built near the foot of the constricted portion of the tumulus and not at the summit suggests that there may have been a change in attitude towards funeral rites.

sen.e: The fact that rituals and tsuiso (the burial of an individual in the same tumulus which has already been occupied by the remains of another person) were held in tsukuridashi built near the foot of the constricted portion of the tumulus and not at the summit suggests that there may have been a change in attitude towards funeral rites.

sen.j: それは、墳頂へ登ることが禁忌され、畏敬されたことと関わっていると考えられる。
sen.e: This is considered to be related to the fact that it was revered and tabooed to go up to the top of a tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is considered that the top of a tomb being regarded as a forbidden and revered area had something to do with such a change.

sen.e: It is considered that the top of a tomb being regarded as a forbidden and revered area had something to do with such a change.

sen.j: 追葬や祭祀は一定期間行われると停止されるものと思われる。
sen.e: It is believed that tsuiso and rituals stopped being held after a certain period of time.

sen.e: It is believed that tsuiso and rituals stopped being held after a certain period of time.

sen.j: 埋葬祭祀で使用された土器は、最古級の前方後円墳では、宮山型特殊器台・特殊壺、この土器から変化した最古の埴輪といわれる都月形円筒埴輪と次に古い特殊壺形埴輪、円筒埴輪、家型埴輪、武器形埴輪、人形埴輪などである。
sen.e: The earthenware that were used in burial rituals include the Miyayama-type special vessel stands and jars as well as the Totsuki-type cylindrical haniwa, which is said to be the oldest haniwa transformed from those previously mentioned earthenware, along with the next oldest group of haniwa including special jar-shaped haniwa, cylindrical haniwa, house-shaped haniwa, weapon-like haniwa, human-shaped haniwa, and so on.

The earthenware used in burial rituals include the Miyayama-type special vessel stands and jars as well as the Totsuki-type cylindrical haniwa, which is said to be the oldest haniwa evolved from the foregoing along with the next oldest group of haniwa including special jar-shaped haniwa, cylindrical haniwa, house-shaped haniwa, weapon-like haniwa and human-shaped haniwa.
sen.cmt: 単語の重複を減らして文章を簡潔にしてあります。
sen.e: The earthenware used in burial rituals include the Miyayama-type special vessel stands and jars as well as the Totsuki-type cylindrical haniwa, which is said to be the oldest haniwa evolved from the foregoing along with the next oldest group of haniwa including special jar-shaped haniwa, cylindrical haniwa, house-shaped haniwa, weapon-like haniwa and human-shaped haniwa.

sen.j: 特殊土器は、日常の器台・壺と違い大きく、また文様で飾られている。。
sen.e: Special earthenware are largely different from everyday vessel stands and jars.

sen.e: Unlike vessel stands and jars for everyday use, special earthenware is large and has decorative patterns.

sen.j: 器台は一メートルほどもあるものもあり、壺も40～50センチぐらい。
sen.e: Some vessel stands are as large as a meter, and jars are about forty to fifty centimeters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Some vessel stands are as much as one meter in height and jars are approximately forty to fifty centimeters tall.
sen.cmt: 意味を明瞭にするために変更。
sen.e: Some vessel stands are as much as one meter in height and jars are approximately forty to fifty centimeters tall.

sen.j: そして、器台に壺を載せると人の肩ほどにもなる。
sen.e: When a jar is placed on top of a vessel stand, the total height becomes as high as one's shoulder.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: When being placed on a vessel stand, the top of the jar will be as high as one's shoulder.

sen.j: このような大きな目立つ道具を使って亡くなった首長の霊魂と首長権を継承するための祭祀を行ったと考えられる。
sen.e: It is considered that rituals were held to succeed to the soul of the deceased chief and the chieftainship, using those big utensils which attract attention.

tit.e: A Stone Chamber Dug into the Side of a Slope
A Stone Chamber Dug into the Side of a Slope
A Stone Chamber Dug into the Side of a Slope

sen.j: 横穴式石室の石室そのものは広い空間である。
sen.e: A stone chamber dug into the side of a slope is a wide open space.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: A stone chamber dug into the side of a slope is a large open space.
A stone chamber dug into the side of a slope is a large open space.

sen.j: そして、一人の死者だけでなく親族や血族の死者を一緒に葬ることができる。
sen.e: And not only a deceased person but also his blood as well as non-blood relatives may be buried there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Not only the remains of one person but also his family members and blood relations can b buried there.
Not only the remains of one person but also his family members and blood relations can b buried there.

sen.j: 今までの竪穴式石室の一人の死者（首長）を葬るという葬法とは大いに違う。
sen.e: It is very different from the burial method preceding it, according to which a deceased person (namely the chief) was buried in a stone chamber dug into the earth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is very different from the previous burial method in which one deceased person (such as the chief) was buried in a stone-lined dugout.
It is very different from the previous burial method in which one deceased person (such as the chief) was buried in a stone-lined dugout.

sen.j: 埋葬観念や埋葬施設に変化が生じた。
sen.e: Hence, there were changes in burial concepts and facilities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Hence, there were changes in burial concepts and facilities.
Hence, there were changes in burial concepts and facilities.

sen.j: 埋葬祭祀は、隅角（前方部の前面の左右のどちらか）から前方部頂へ登り、そこから後円部に向かって降りていき、隆起斜道（後円部へ登りやすくした斜面）を登り、掘割墓道（石室への道）を経て墓壙に入る。
sen.e: Burial rituals take place in the following order: go up to the top of the front square using the cornered intersection (on either the right or the left of the frontal surface of the square front), go down toward the rounded rear from there, climb the ryuki shado (a slope made to make it easier to climb to the rounded rear), and enter the burial pit through a horiwari bodo (a path to the stone chamber).

Burial rituals take place in the following order: ascend to the top of the front square via a corner (on either the right or left of the frontal surface of the square front), descend toward the rounded rear, go up the ryuki shado (a slope built to make it easier to climb to the rounded rear), and enter the burial pit through a horiwari bodo (a path to the stone chamber).

Burial rituals take place in the following order: ascend to the top of the front square via a corner (on either the right or left of the frontal surface of the square front), descend toward the rounded rear, go up the ryuki shado (a slope built to make it easier to climb to the rounded rear), and enter the burial pit through a horiwari bodo (a path to the stone chamber).

sen.j: 石室は後円部頂に入り口を前方部方向に向けて造る。
sen.e: The stone chamber is built on the top of the rounded rear with an entrance facing the direction of the front square.
The stone chamber is built on the top of the rounded rear with its entrance facing the front square.
The stone chamber is built on the top of the rounded rear with its entrance facing the front square.

sen.j: このような古式の例は、福岡県老司古墳や鋤崎古墳に見ることができる。
sen.e: Examples can be seen in Roji-kofun Tumulus and Sukizaki-kofun Tumulus in Fukuoka Prefecture.
Examples of the stone chamber built in accordance with ancient ritual as mentioned in the foregoing can be seen in Roji-kofun Tumulus and Sukizaki-kofun Tumulus in Fukuoka Prefecture.
Examples of the stone chamber built in accordance with ancient ritual as mentioned in the foregoing can be seen in Roji-kofun Tumulus and Sukizaki-kofun Tumulus in Fukuoka Prefecture.

tit.j: 朝鮮半島南部の前方後円墳
tit.e: Keyhole-Shaped Tumuli in the Southern Korean Peninsula
Keyhole-Shaped Tumuli in the Southern Korean Peninsula
Keyhole-Shaped Tumuli in the Southern Korean Peninsula

sen.j: 韓国最大の古墳としては、全長120メートルの新羅慶州の皇南大塚が知られている。
sen.e: Hwangnam Great Tumulus, whose total length is 120 meters in Kyŏngju, Silla is known to be the oldest tumulus in the Republic of Korea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Hwangnam Great Tumulus in Kyŏngju, Silla, with its total length measuring 120 meters, is known to be the oldest tumulus in the Republic of Korea.
Hwangnam Great Tumulus in Kyŏngju, Silla, with its total length measuring 120 meters, is known to be the oldest tumulus in the Republic of Korea.

sen.j: だが、これは墳形が双円墳であり、日本の前方後円墳とは系統が異なっている。
sen.e: However, it is a tumulus composed of two circles, and it does not share the same lineage as keyhole-shaped tumuli in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, it is composed of two round mounds, being a different variety from keyhole-shaped tumuli in Japan.
However, it is composed of two round mounds, being a different variety from keyhole-shaped tumuli in Japan.

sen.j: しかし、1983年に大韓民国慶尚南道固城の松鶴洞一号墳が前方後円墳であるとして紹介されて以来、朝鮮半島南西部で前方後円墳の発見が相次いだ。
sen.e: Yet, keyhole-shaped tumuli were found one after another in the southwestern Korean Peninsula after the introduction of Shokakudo No. 1 Kofun Tumulus, which is located in Kosŏng, South Kyŏngsang, the Republic of Korea, as one of them in 1993.

Yet, keyhole-shaped tumuli were found one after another in the southwestern Korean Peninsula after the introduction of Shokakudo No. 1 Kofun Tumulus, which is located in Kosŏng, South Kyŏngsang, the Republic of Korea, as one of them in 1993.

Yet, keyhole-shaped tumuli were found one after another in the southwestern Korean Peninsula after the introduction of Shokakudo No. 1 Kofun Tumulus, which is located in Kosŏng, South Kyŏngsang, the Republic of Korea, as one of them in 1993.

sen.j: その後の調査により、松鶴洞一号墳は築成時期の異なる3基の円墳が重なり合ったものであり、前方後円墳ではないことが明らかになった。
sen.e: Later investigation revealed that it is made up of three round barrows built at different periods that are lying on top of one another and it is not a keyhole-shaped tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The subsequent investigation revealed that Shokakudo No. 1 Kofun Tumulus consisted of three overlapping round barrows with each of them having been built in different times whereby it became apparent that it was not a keyhole-shaped tumulus.

The subsequent investigation revealed that Shokakudo No. 1 Kofun Tumulus consisted of three overlapping round barrows with each of them having been built in different times whereby it became apparent that it was not a keyhole-shaped tumulus.

sen.j: とはいえ、現在までに全羅南道に11基、全羅北道に2基の前方後円墳が確認されている。
sen.e: Still, eleven and two keyhole-shaped tumuli have been confirmed so far in South Chŏlla and North Chŏlla, respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: On the other hand, there are eleven and two keyhole-shaped tumuli that have been confirmed to date in South Chŏlla and North Chŏlla, respectively.
On the other hand, there are eleven and two keyhole-shaped tumuli that have been confirmed to date in South Chŏlla and North Chŏlla, respectively.

sen.j: 朝鮮半島の前方後円墳はいずれも5世紀後半から6世紀中葉という極めて限られた時期に成立したものである。
sen.e: Every keyhole-shaped tumulus in the Korean Peninsula was formed during a very limited time period running from the latter half of the fifth century to the middle of the sixth century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: All of the keyhole-shaped tumuli in the Korean Peninsula were built in a very limited time period between the latter half of the fifth century and the middle of the sixth century.
All of the keyhole-shaped tumuli in the Korean Peninsula were built in a very limited time period between the latter half of the fifth century and the middle of the sixth century.

sen.j: 百済の国境沿いに近い伽耶の地のみに存在する。
sen.e: They are only seen in Gaya near the border of Paekche.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: They are only seen in Gaya near the border of Paekche.
They are only seen in Gaya near the border of Paekche.

sen.j: 墳丘長は80メートルないし100メートル規模。
sen.e: The lengths of their burial mounds are eighty to 100 meters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The length of these burial mounds varies in the range of 80 to 100 meters.
The length of these burial mounds varies in the range of 80 to 100 meters.

sen.j: 円筒埴輪や南島産貝製品、内部をベンガラで塗った石室といった倭系遺物を伴うことが知られている。
sen.e: And it is known that they are accompanied by Japanese artifacts, such as cylindrical haniwa, shell objects from the southern islands, and a stone chamber whose inside is painted in red-ocher.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is known that some Japanese artifacts, such as cylindrical haniwa, items made of seashells from the southern islands and a stone chamber painted with red-ocher inside have been found in these burial mounds.

It is known that some Japanese artifacts, such as cylindrical haniwa, items made of seashells from the southern islands and a stone chamber painted with red-ocher inside have been found in these burial mounds.

sen.j: そのことから、これらの前方後円墳は、当時南下しようとして盛んにこの地域に圧力をかけていた百済に対抗すべく、倭人の勢力と結託してその文化・風習を積極的に取り入れた伽耶の在地領主の墳墓ではないかという説が出されている。
sen.e: This has led to the emergence of an opinion that these keyhole-shaped tumuli might be the tombs of the local lords of Gaya who conspired with the forces of Wa in order to confront Paekche, which was then vigorously pressuring Gaya in an effort to advance southward, and who also actively adopted its culture and customs.

The discovery mentioned in the foregoing generated an opinion suggesting that these keyhole-shaped tumuli may have been tombs of the local lords of Gaya who joined forces with powerful Japanese to retaliate against Paekche, which, in an attempt to advance southward, was putting enormous pressure on Gaya in those days when Gaya also actively adopted culture and customs of Japan.

The discovery mentioned in the foregoing generated an opinion suggesting that these keyhole-shaped tumuli may have been tombs of the local lords of Gaya who joined forces with powerful Japanese to retaliate against Paekche, which, in an attempt to advance southward, was putting enormous pressure on Gaya in those days when Gaya also actively adopted culture and customs of Japan.

sen.j: 基本的にこうした前方後円墳の大きさは、朝廷とどの程度親密か、どの程度の地位があるかのよって決定される。
sen.e: Basically, their sizes are determined by the closeness of the local lords to the Imperial Court and their status levels.
The size of these keyhole-shaped tumuli was fundementally decided by how close those local lords were to the Imperial Court as well as their status.
The size of these keyhole-shaped tumuli was fundementally decided by how close those local lords were to the Imperial Court as well as their status.

sen.j: 朝廷に従属した部族、集落の長の前方後円墳はちょうど80メートルないし100メートル規模であることが多い。
sen.e: With regard to the chiefs of the tribes and communities that were subordinate to the Imperial Court, their keyhole-shaped tumuli are often eighty to 100 meters.
With regard to chiefs of tribes and communities that were subordinate to the Imperial Court, their keyhole-shaped tumuli are often eighty to 100 meters in length.
With regard to chiefs of tribes and communities that were subordinate to the Imperial Court, their keyhole-shaped tumuli are often eighty to 100 meters in length.

sen.j: こうした例は日本においても、7世紀以前の東北地方において多くみられる。
sen.e: These examples are also found in the Tohoku region of Japan prior to the seventh century.
These examples are also found in the Tohoku region of Japan prior to the seventh century.
These examples are also found in the Tohoku region of Japan prior to the seventh century.

sen.j: また、この地方の国守として倭より派遣されていたとされる穂積臣押山（ほづみのおみおしやま。『日本書紀』継体六(512)年条に記述がある）のような倭人領主の墳墓と見る説もある。
sen.e: There is also another opinion that regards them as the tombs of the lords who were dispatched from Wa as provincial governors like Hozumi no Omi Oshiyama (described in the article concerning 512, or Keitai 6 in old lunar calendar, of "Nihon Shoki" (The Chronicles of Japan)).
sen.cmt: 一度一文にした後一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: There is also another opinion that they are the tombs of the Japanese lords who were sent from Japan as provincial governors such as Hozumi no Omi Oshiyama (as mentioned in the chapter covering 512 of "Nihon Shoki" (The Chronicles of Japan)).

There is also another opinion that they are the tombs of the Japanese lords who were sent from Japan as provincial governors such as Hozumi no Omi Oshiyama (as mentioned in the chapter covering 512 of "Nihon Shoki" (The Chronicles of Japan)).

sen.j: そして、墳墓に眠る人物の身元はいまだに確定していない。
sen.e: The identities of the persons buried in them have not yet been established.
sen.cmt: 一度一文にした後一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The individuals buried in these tombs remain unidentified to date.
The individuals buried in these tombs remain unidentified to date.
